title: Linear and rotation - race car and omega of wheels

content.question: A race car has small front wheels of radius <math alttext="R sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>F</mtext></msub></math> and large rear wheels of radius <math alttext="R sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>, where <math alttext="R sub R is greater than R sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>R</mi><mtext>F</mtext></msub></math>, as shown in the figure. As the car moves to the left along a straight track with no slipping between the wheels and the track, which of the following correctly describes the angular velocities <math alttext="omega sub F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mtext>F</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="omega sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> of the front and rear wheels, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="omega sub F equals omega sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mtext>F</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, both clockwise

<math alttext="omega sub F equals omega sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mtext>F</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>ω</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>, both counterclockwise
